dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The Aktobe reservoir has lost nearly a third of its water already, according to local environmentalists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Aktobe reservoir has lost nearly a third of its water already, according to local environmentalists.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to activists, nearly one-third of the reservoir has already dried up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the sand mining on the dried-up lakebed is just devastating the fish habitats, right? It's wiping out those spawning grounds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the sand mining on the dried-up lakebed is just devastating the fish habitats, right? It's wiping out those spawning grounds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On the exposed lakebed, sand mining is actively taking place ' a practice that, according to gamekeepers, is wreaking havoc on local fish habitats. These areas used to be spawning grounds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Alexey Gogel from the Aktobe Society of Hunters and Fishers says it's caused massive damage to aquatic resources. Those areas used to be full of life, vegetation…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Alexey Gogel from the Aktobe Society of Hunters and Fishers says it's caused massive damage to aquatic resources. Those areas used to be full of life, vegetation...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This has caused significant damage to aquatic resources, said Alexey Gogel, chairman of the Aktobe Society of Hunters and Fishers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And now they're just… stripped. Dug out completely. It's not just natural drying—it's industrial.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now they're just... stripped. Dug out completely. It's not just natural drying-it's industrial.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The banks of the Aktobe reservoir are being destroyed not just by natural factors but by ballast extraction. These areas used to be spawning grounds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: What's worse, the sand extraction is actually accelerating the evaporation. It disrupts those waterproof layers underground that feed water into the reservoir.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What's worse, the sand extraction is actually accelerating the evaporation. It disrupts those waterproof layers underground that feed water into the reservoir.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The mining allegedly disrupts the waterproof layers that feed underground water into lakes and rivers, accelerating evaporation and reducing water inflow. The excavation work increases the surface area of evaporation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So it's like a vicious cycle. The mining makes the water disappear faster, and then they mine more of the exposed bed…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's like a vicious cycle. The mining makes the water disappear faster, and then they mine more of the exposed bed...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And despite that, two subsoil users are operating there, with permits granted just this year for a ten-year period.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And despite that, two subsoil users are operating there, with permits granted just this year for a ten-year period.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two subsoil users are operating at three sand extraction sites along the Aktobe reservoir. The right to subsoil use was granted in 2024 for a 10-year period, based on approvals from authorized state bodies regarding environmental and industrial safety regulations, said Abylai Zhumagulov, the department spokesperson.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the regional department says everything's legally approved, but environmental groups are pushing back hard. They want an independent assessment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the regional department says everything's legally approved, but environmental groups are pushing back hard. They want an independent assessment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite the legal approvals, environmental groups insist that regulatory compliance should not come at the expense of the ecosystem. They are calling for an independent environmental assessment to measure the damage to aquatic life and recommend urgent action.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They've submitted complaints, and now they're appealing directly to the governor for a ban on industrial activity in protected zones.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They've submitted complaints, and now they're appealing directly to the governor for a ban on industrial activity in protected zones.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nature protection organizations have submitted formal complaints to local authorities. Activists are now appealing directly to the regional governor to impose an immediate ban on all industrial activity in protected water zones.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's tough because, like, on paper it might be compliant, but the ecosystem is clearly paying the price.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's tough because, like, on paper it might be compliant, but the ecosystem is clearly paying the price.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Total desiccation is a real threat here. Once that water's gone, it's not coming back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Total desiccation is a real threat here. Once that water's gone, it's not coming back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Total desiccation is a real threat, said members of the Society of Hunters and Fishers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And with spawning grounds destroyed, the fish populations may never recover either. It's heartbreaking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And with spawning grounds destroyed, the fish populations may never recover either. It's heartbreaking.
